attributes.comment:
The fee increase for these services is inappropriate without concurrently extending
the time that an I171-H is valid. International adoption waiting times have been
significantly increasing the past 18 months for a variety of overseas programs and
most families are finding that they need to renew at least once, if not twice, during
the wait. An increase in price, especially such a huge increase, would be more
palatable if the validity of the I171-H was extended to at least 24 months.

Further, the requirement that for renewal of an I171-H, fingerprints must be taken
again is ridiculous at best, simply redundant at worst. Once the fingerprints are
taken for the initial application, they need to be made readily retrievable until the
adoption is complete and used again at the FBI, if necessary. Fingerprints do not
change and requiring adoptive families to, sometimes, travel great distances for a
second round of fingerprinting for a renewal is tedious and unacceptable.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Karen A. Greene
